result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Derreck Reynold Paull

records.addlTxt: 2:04 PM Defendant Derreck Reynold Paull in court, in custody.  Attorney Michelle M Erdman appeared by video for Derreck Reynold Paull.  Attorney Bruce Robert Poquette in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and recites appearances.  DEF indicates Plea Questionnaire is completed, left in jail.  Attny Erdman uploaded one into case 21CF241 for court to review.   DEF to supply completed plea questionnaire to jail staff for filing.   Court reviews with DEF the right to have Attny present, DEF agrees to proceed with Attny by video.   State recites agreement, all parties agree.     As part of the agreement, Case is dismissed and read in.  Court finds Victim Rights Legislation has been complied with.

8:20 AM Defendant Derreck Reynold Paull appeared by video, in custody from Sawyer County Jail.  Attorney Michelle M Erdman appeared by video for Derreck Reynold Paull.  Attorney Bruce Robert Poquette in court for State of Wisconsin.  Court calls case and recites appearances.  Attny Erdman indicates offer was received and reviewed with DEF, request to set for Plea/sentencing.

11:06 AM Defendant Derreck Reynold Paull in court.  Attorney Michelle M Erdman appeared by video for Derreck Reynold Paull.  Attorney Bruce Robert Poquette in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and recites appearances.   Warrant quashed.  Attny Erdman makes statement as to DEF missed appearance.    Court addresses violation report filed by Justice Point.  Justice Report Representative H. Lessard in court, makes statement to court.    Attny Erdman makes statement.   DEF makes statement regarding violation of bond,  Court addresses DEF.    Attny Erdman indicates trial will need to be set in Case 21CF241.   State makes statement regarding bond, requests cash bond be reinstated.  Attny Erdman argues states recommendations.  DEF makes further statement to court.   Court addresses DEF.    11:26 OFF THE RECORD:  DEF to be tested by Justice Point.    11:50 AM  BACK ON THE RECORD:   Representative from Justice Point gives results.  Court addresses DEF.    Court amends bonds   CBS $1000   COMBINED BOND  21CF241, 21CF258, 22CM23   ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/ No Possession or Consumption of Alcoholic Beverages. 2:45 PM Defendant Derreck Reynold Paull appeared by video, from in custody from Barron County Jail, with Attorney Michelle M Erdman,  appearing by video.  Attorney Kenneth Sortedahl appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case (21CF258, 21CF241, 22CM23) and recites appearances. State makes a statement, does oppose a reduction in bond.  Atty Erdman makes statement in support of bond reduction, requesting signature bond.  Court addresses DEF, DEF responds.  Court indicates bond in 22CM23 will remain unchanged.  Court indicates bond in 21CF258 and 21CF241 will be altered to SIBS $2500 with no change in conditions.  Court instructs DEF to contact Justice Point by Noon on 5/19/22.   Atty Erdman indicates cases previously set for STC on 6/14/22, wishes to keep this on calendar.  Court will keep STC's on calendar.
